description: Lydia Tr commands with the gravitational pull of a planet: Everyone and everything, including the camera in Tr, Todd Fields epic about a fictional maestro, lives in her shadow. But when Lydia (Cate Blanchett), who has been accused of sexual harassment, sets her sights on Olga, a rising Russian cellist, she is confronted with a foil of sorts. Is the young woman disarmingly nave or particularly cunning?

title: 5.1-Magnitude Earthquake Jolts Bay Area
description: A 5.1-magnitude earthquake rattled the San Francisco Bay Area on Tuesday, according to the U.S. Geological Survey. There were no immediate reports of injuries or damage.

title: Biden to Russia: Using Nuclear Weapon Would Be Serious Mistake
description: President Biden warned President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia against using a tactical nuclear weapon on Ukraine. The Kremlin has accused Kyiv, without providing evidence, of planning to set off a dirty bomb.

title: The Try Guys and the Prison of Online Fame
description: The thing about the video is that people like me werent really supposed to be watching it. You could tell from the first line: Ned Fulmer is no longer working with the Try Guys. If those proper nouns held any significance for you five weeks ago, you were the intended audience. If not, well: The Try Guys are four dudes who make a goofy, mild-mannered web series in which they test out different experiences, like wearing corsets, doing stand-up comedy or eating really spicy noodles. Ned Fulmer was one Guy, as well as the subject of frenzied speculation among fans; rumors were circulating that he was cheating on his wife with a woman who starred in a spinoff series called Food Babies. Now the other three Try Guys were here to break the sad news to their eight million YouTube subscribers: It was true. (Fulmer did not respond to a request for comment for this article, though he has confirmed and apologized for the relationship on Instagram.)

title: Microsoft Reports Slowest Revenue Growth in Five Years
description: Facing a strong U.S. dollar and weakening personal computer sales, Microsoft on Tuesday reported its slowest growth in five years.

title: Alphabets Profit Drops 27 Percent From a Year Earlier
description: Even Alphabet, the parent company of Google and one of the internets most entrenched businesses, was not immune to the punishing blows of the global economy and a sharp slowdown in the online advertising that is essential to the companys profits.

title: Deadline Nearing, White House Plans Wider Changes to Public Service Student Loan Relief
description: Days before the deadline for applicants to take advantage of a set of temporary rule exceptions to the governments student loan forgiveness program for borrowers who work in public service, the Education Department moved to make some of the changes permanent  but not until next year.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Tensions Rise in the West Bank
description: Israeli forces carried out a major raid against a new Palestinian militia in Nablus, a city in the occupied West Bank. Palestinian officials and militia members said the raid yesterday killed a leader of the group and four other men.

title: Sunak Faces Political Test of His Career: Unify Party and Fix the Economy
description: LONDON  Rishi Sunak took over as Britains prime minister on Tuesday, the third in seven weeks, hoping to slow the revolving door at 10 Downing Street and restore stability to a government in turmoil.

title: Biden Urges Americans to Get New Covid Booster Shot Before Winter
description: The president received his third coronavirus booster shot, his fifth vaccine dose overall, about three months after contracting the virus.

title: Allow Natalia Lafourcade to Reintroduce Herself
description: Over a balky wireless connection that seemed to symbolize how fleeting human contact has become, Natalia Lafourcade smiled as she showed off her garden in Xalapa, the capital of the Mexican state of Veracruz. She had emerged from the recording studio she built there, rattling off the trees that surround her home  guayabo, higuera, mulato  as she explained the genesis of her new album, De Todas las Flores (Of All the Flowers), which bloomed in the aftermath of a romantic split.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Fetterman and Oz debated in Pennsylvania; Hochul and Zeldin met in New York.
description: Several debates took place on Tuesday evening. Heres what to know:

title: T 101 | Ina Garten & Daniel Roseberry
description: The cookbook author Ina Garten teaches the fashion designer Daniel Roseberry how to make one-pot risotto in her kitchen in East Hampton, N.Y.

title: Ina Garten Makes Risotto With a Longtime Fan
description: The designer Daniel Roseberry recalls first encountering Barefoot Contessa, the cookbook author Ina Gartens hit series on Food Network, in 2006, during his freshman year at New Yorks Fashion Institute of Technology. He instantly became hooked on the show, in which the warmly bantering Garten welcomes viewers into her East Hampton, N.Y., kitchen and guides them through the preparation of classic, luscious often-French-inspired fare. From the minute I saw Inas world, Roseberry says, I wanted to be a part of it.

title: U.S. Officials Had a Secret Oil Deal With the Saudis. Or So They Thought.
description: WASHINGTON  As President Biden was planning a politically risky trip to Saudi Arabia this summer, his top aides thought they had struck a secret deal to boost oil production through the end of the year  an arrangement that could have helped justify breaking a campaign pledge to shun the kingdom and its crown prince.

title: Putin Is Onto Us
description: As the Russian Army continues to falter in Ukraine, the world is worrying that Vladimir Putin could use a tactical nuclear weapon. Maybe  but for now, I think Putin is assembling a different weapon. Its an oil and gas bomb that hes fusing right before our eyes and with our inadvertent help  and he could easily detonate it this winter.

title: Brittney Griners Prison Term Is Upheld by Russian Court
description: A Russian appeals court on Tuesday upheld a nine-year prison sentence imposed on Brittney Griner, the American basketball star arrested after she arrived in the country carrying a small amount of hash oil.

title: The Astros and the Phillies in a Big Series? Weve Seen This Before.
description: Follow live coverage of the Astros vs Phillies in game 1 of the World Series.

title: How Saudi Arabias Blowup With Biden Threatens Democrats in 2022
description: Only three months have gone by since President Biden gave Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia, the fist bump heard round the world.

title: Biden Says Russian Use of a Nuclear Weapon Would Be a Serious Mistake
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden renewed his warning to President Vladimir V. Putin on Tuesday that it would be an incredibly serious mistake to use a tactical nuclear weapon in Ukraine, reflecting the increasingly urgent concern in Washington and among Western allies that Russia may be searching for a pretext to unleash such a weapon.

title: Some Breast Cancer Patients Could Skip Surgery, Study Suggests
description: The conventional approach to fighting breast cancer is to deploy all the tools modern medicine has to offer. Surgery to excise the tumor is considered a critically important step, along with drugs, radiation, and hormone treatments and immunotherapy when appropriate.

title: Corrections: Oct. 26, 2022
description: An article on Tuesday about the likelihood that Detroit, the nations largest majority Black city, will not have a Black representative in Congress for the first time in almost 70 years gave an erroneous distinction to Martell Bivings. He is one of two Black candidates on the ballot in Michigans 13th Congressional District, not the only Black candidate.

title: Montag Review: A Dark Hymn to Female Friendship
description: In a basement apartment somewhere in Germany, Faith (Ariana Venturi) chain smokes cigarettes and drinks endless cups of coffee. Novella (Nadine Malouf) chomps her way through a bag of spicy chips. They argue, they dance, they try on clubwear, they play anxious games. Like lots of characters in lots of plays before them, they are waiting. But not for God or liberation or even a gentleman caller, not exactly. They are waiting for the man who is coming to kill them.

title: Justice Dept. Seeks to Force Trump White House Lawyers to Testify in Jan. 6 Inquiry
description: The Justice Department has asked a federal judge to force the two top lawyers in Donald J. Trumps White House to provide additional grand jury testimony as prosecutors seek to break through the former presidents attempts to shield his efforts to overturn the 2020 election from investigation, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: Battle for New York: 5 Takeaways From the Hochul-Zeldin Debate
description: In their only scheduled debate, Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York and her challenger, Representative Lee Zeldin, quarreled intensely on Tuesday over divisive issues such as rising crime and abortion access, while accusing each other of corruption and dangerous extremism.

title: Alito Says Leak of Ruling Overturning Roe Put Justices Lives at Risk
description: WASHINGTON  The leak of his draft majority opinion overruling Roe v. Wade put the Supreme Court justices in the majority at risk of assassination, Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. said during wide-ranging remarks in a public interview on Tuesday at the Heritage Foundation, a conservative legal group.

title: Take Some Down Time
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Congratulations to Simeon Seigel, who is making his fourth appearance in the New York Times Crossword. Mr. Seigels puzzles tend to be a little tough, with the previous three all falling on Thursdays. Todays Wednesday puzzle may be a tad easier, but it still uses a pretty neat trick!

title: Review: This Time, A Raisin in the Sun Really Does Explode
description: Leaving his recent Long Days Journey Into Night aside, Robert OHara doesnt typically direct revivals; nor, leaving Shakespeare aside, does the Public Theater typically produce them. Yet on Tuesday the Public opened OHaras take on Lorraine Hansberrys A Raisin in the Sun: not merely a revival but a further exploration of an earlier production of a 1959 classic that is arguably as well known today as it was epochal when it debuted.

title: Quotation of the Day: Here, Snow Is Life. What if It Disappears?
description: He told them to put it in a walking boot, and he tied it on the saddle with a gunny sack.

title: Fetterman, Showing Stroke Effects, Battles Oz in Hostile Senate Debate
description: Five months after a stroke nearly took his life, Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, the Democratic nominee for Senate in Pennsylvania, clashed with Dr. Mehmet Oz on Tuesday in their one and only debate, disagreeing sharply over abortion, the economy and other partisan issues as Mr. Fetterman tried to assure voters of his fitness to serve.

title: 5 Takeaways From the Pennsylvania Senate Debate
description: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania and Mehmet Oz, the celebrity television doctor, collided Tuesday in one of the most closely watched debates of the midterm campaign. The Pennsylvania Senate matchup was both highly personal and unusual, as viewers watched Mr. Fetterman, a Democrat, rely on closed captioning to accommodate for the lingering effects of a stroke he had in May.

title: Brady and Rodgers Have Played Badly but That Will Change, Right?
description: The 2022 N.F.L. season is shaping up to be an extinction-level event for several once-mighty dinosaur quarterbacks.

title: A Former W.W.E. Wrestler Taps In Against Concussion Deniers
description: Christopher Nowinski was rubbing elbows at the New York Athletic Club one Thursday night last month, when the tweets and texts started rolling in. He was there to speak at a fund-raiser for head-trauma research when Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa was carted from an N.F.L. game with a severe concussion, the second gruesome head hit the player took in a week.

title: Candidates in New York Governors Race Debate Abortion Access
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York criticized her challenger, Representative Lee Zeldin, on his anti-abortion stance. Mr. Zeldin vowed that he would not seek to unilaterally change the states strict abortion protections.

title: L.A.P.D. Opens Criminal Inquiry Into Recording That Captured Racist Remarks
description: The Los Angeles Police Department is investigating whether a secretly recorded conversation among three City Council members and a labor leader that included racist insults and slurs was made illegally, Chief Michel Moore said on Tuesday.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Although Germany has long been Europes de facto leader, it has been slow to provide serious military equipment to Ukraine. It has also subsidized its own citizens energy bills while working to water down a price cap on gas that could alleviate pain in poorer E.U. countries. And now its allies are worried.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Wonders Why Trump Would Talk to Bob Woodward
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: prerogative
description: The word prerogative has appeared in 81 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Aug. 17 in Willie Nelsons Long Encore by Jody Rosen:

title: The Instant Legend of Kvaradona
description: BATUMI, Georgia  They used to worry that the Adjarabet Arena, with its sinuous arches and illuminated exterior, would turn into something of a white elephant. Batumi, after all, is a quaint resort town; it had little need for a 20,000-capacity stadium. Dinamo, the soccer team that was to call it home, generally required seating for only half that number.

title: The Hochul-Zeldin Debate: A Combative Clash
description: Good morning. Its Wednesday. Well recap last nights tense and testy debate between the two candidates for governor in New York. Well also look at a city report that found that the Open Streets program helped some eating and drinking establishments weather the pandemic.

title: Ukrainians find devastation where Russians retreat.
description: KAMIANKA, Ukraine  Little moved in the village of Kamianka, except for a cat bolting from under the rubble of a destroyed house and metal roofing banging in the wind.

title: Natural gas prices are falling in Europe despite the war and dwindling supply.
description: The war in Ukraine is raging, Russian natural gas exports to Europe are dwindling and the winter heating season is approaching. That would seem like a recipe for higher prices, yet the cost of the fuel, which is vital for heating homes and for powering electricity plants and industry, has been plummeting.

title: TikTok Searches
description: According to a recent article, more and more young people are using TikTok as a search engine  to answer questions, find out how to do things, and uncover recommendations for restaurants, recipes, films, books and more.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: WEDNESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Climate Pledges Are Falling Short, and a Chaotic Future Looks More Like Reality
description: Countries around the world are failing to live up to their commitments to fight climate change, pointing Earth toward a future marked by more intense flooding, wildfires, drought, heat waves and species extinction, according to a report issued Wednesday by the United Nations.

title: Elon Musk Seems to Answer to No One. Except for a Judge in Delaware.
description: Chancellor Kathaleen St. J. McCormick has become a very important person in the rambunctious life of Elon Musk.

title: Shunned by the West, Russia and Myanmar Form a Partnership of Unequals
description: Myanmar has been cut off from the West and shunned by its neighbors after its military seized power last year and imposed a brutal crackdown. Even China, its closest ally, has signaled it is not thrilled about the instability.

title: Should We Get Rid of Homework?
description: Do you like doing homework? Do you think it has benefited you educationally?

title: What My Fathers Death Taught Me About Living
description: We buried my dad on Friday. He asked to be interred in a pine box. He had long ago lost his once ardent interest in organized religion, but he remained committed right up to the end to the idea that burial helps the soul escape the body.

title: Read Your Way Through Istanbul
description: Ever since the Byzantine times, Istanbul has been home to artists, poets and storytellers. It is a city of abundant tales and legends, but also of too many secrets, buried deep. As a novelist, I find it important to pay attention to not only its stories but also its silences. Those silences matter greatly  the voices of the marginalized, the forgotten or the ones who have been pushed to the periphery. These are the stories that are never mentioned in the official history.

title: Maybe Gen Z Is Just Kinder: How Americas Youngest Voters Are Shaping Politics
description: Members of Gen Z (Americans under 26 years old) have come of age during Donald Trumps presidency and a pandemic, in an era of protests over police violence, attacks on reproductive rights, rising economic inequality and frequent school shootings. These young people are calling for major changes, but many arent confident that politicians will act with the urgency necessary to carry them out. As Gen Z voters consider the midterms, they are prioritizing the issues, not party allegiance.

title: Newsom vs. DeSantis Is Our Inevitable Culture War
description: Since the leak of the Dobbs decision in May, the conservative organization CatholicVote has counted 75 attacks on pro-life organizations around the country  vandalism, arson, graffiti, a firebombing. A group calling itself Janes Revenge has taken responsibility for some of the attacks, though its not clear whether this is a real pro-choice terrorist organization or just a conveniently unifying slogan. But then very little about these incidents is clear, because while officially the Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating, so far it has not publicized any arrests.

title: This Thanksgiving, Make a Jell-O Salad Instead of Cranberry Sauce
description: In a 1952 Better Homes and Gardens recipe for Lime Cheese Salad, an otherworldly combination of vinegar, grated onion, cottage cheese and mayonnaise is suspended in a lurid green fruit gelatin. Six delighted people will love the unusual flavor of this easy-to-make, wonderful-to-eat, Jell-O salad, the magazine advertisement reads. It can be difficult to imagine a world in which this unusual flavor is highlighted, on purpose, to increase sales of boxed Jell-O.

title: How Serge Diaghilev Made Art Happen
description: In the early 21st century, millennials are mocked for saying, I did a thing! In the early 20th, Serge Diaghilev, the formidable Russian impresario, was worshiped because, in the words of his artistic adviser Alexandre Benois, he knew how to will a thing. Overseeing creative collaboration on a grand and memorable scale, Diaghilev rolled right over the doubters and haters of the belle epoque and beyond.

title: An Era Just Ended in China
description: Forty-four years ago, Deng Xiaoping kicked off the period of reform and opening up that transformed China from a poor, autarkic nation into an emerging global power.

title: Lesson Plan: Some Kids Play Sports. These Kids Train Wild Horses.
description: Featured Article: Some Kids Play Sports. These Kids Train Wild Horses. Photographs by Maggie Shannon and text by Jill Cowan

title: Think Affirmative Action Is Dead? Think Again.
description: On Oct. 31, only hours before millions of children get dressed up for trick-or-treating, nine Supreme Court justices will don their robes to hear oral arguments about the future of affirmative action. The dominant, almost universal expectation is that the court will eliminate race-conscious admissions in June, at the end of this term.

title: Campaign Press Aides Move From the Shadows to Star on Social Media
description: MINDEN, Nev.  As Adam Laxalt, the Republican candidate for Senate in Nevada, ambled along a throng of Trump supporters at a recent rally and posed for pictures, it was his campaigns communications director, Courtney Holland, who was really working the crowd.

title: Republicans Denounce Inflation, but Few Economists Expect Their Plans to Help
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans are riding a wave of anger over inflation as they seek to recapture the House and the Senate this fall, hammering Democrats on President Bidens economic policies, which they say have fueled the fastest price gains in 40 years.

title: The Left-Right Divide Might Help Democrats Avoid a Total Wipeout
description: With the midterm election less than two weeks away, polling has turned bleak for the Democrats, not only increasing the likelihood that the party will lose control of the House but also dimming the prospects that it will hold the Senate.

title: How They Assembled the Kimberly Akimbo Puzzle
description: The toilets wouldnt stop flushing. The playwright David Lindsay-Abaire was trying to talk about his collaboration with the composer Jeanine Tesori and the director Jessica Stone on their musical, Kimberly Akimbo, and in the background, the janitorial staff members of the Booth Theater were cleaning the bathrooms.

title: This Environmental Law Made Half of Americas Fresh Waters Swimmable and Fishable
description: In the early 1830s, the French historian Alexis de Tocqueville, on his way to the Great Lakes, is said to have described the waters around Cleveland as among the clearest he had ever seen. Less than four decades later, in 1868, a river he had greatly admired, the Cuyahoga, by then choked with industrial and municipal waste, burst into flames. It would do this periodically until 1969, when one last blaze persuaded the editors of Time magazines new environment section to publish pictures of the Cuyahoga on fire. Some river! Time exclaimed. Chocolate brown, oily, bubbling with subsurface gases, it oozes rather than flows.

title: A Landmark as Women Will Coach Against Each Other in Mens Soccer
description: A significant moment in college sports history will unfold on Friday when two mens soccer teams meet at little Gaelic Park in the Bronx  not because of the teams involved, but because of who is coaching them.

title: How Elon Musk Became a Geopolitical Chaos Agent
description: Elon Musk closes his purchase of Twitter and fires several top executives. Follow for the latest news updates.

title: The Slow Burn That Is Henry Taylor
description: LOS ANGELES  It is midafternoon on a warm day in the West Adams neighborhood, and Henry Taylors capable studio director, Brandi Morris, would clearly prefer that the artist not take the wheel.

title: The Essential Philip K. Dick
description: The K stands for Kindred. It was a family name, but if theres anyone who can forgive a fanciful imputation of significance, it is Philip K. Dick. How lovely that a poet of alienation would come into existence bearing that word.

title: How One Woman Risked the Great Migration, and Found Opportunity in a New Life
description: Growing up in Miami in the 1950s, Dorothy Glinton saw women in the military for the first time and decided she wanted to join. But when she told her family, they responded that nice girls dont go in the army. So they just talked me out of that, you know, but thats what I really, truly wanted to be, she said in a recent conversation. Though she never did join the military, that instance was one of the few times she has ever been talked out of pursuing something she wanted.

title: Its a Goth Thing: Meet the Martha Stewart for Macabre Homemakers
description: At the Gothic Renaissance store near Union Square in Manhattan, a man clad in all black, with his hair and beard dyed to match, navigated a maze of corsets, steampunk goggles and winged harnesses to a rack of outerwear. From it he pulled a black velveteen Victorian-style tuxedo jacket called the Baphomet. Made by the label Devil Fashion, it had embroidery at the collar and cuffs, a braided frog closure at the chest and tails as pointy as the horns of its namesake goat-headed deity. The price on its tag: $220.

title: Can a Start-Up Help Companies Monitor and Manage Their Water Use?
description: This article is part of Upstart, a series about companies harnessing new science and technology to solve challenges in their industries.

title: How Biden Uses His Car Guy Persona to Burnish His Everyman Image
description: WASHINGTON  At a Secret Service training facility in Maryland late this summer, President Biden peeled out in his cherished 1967 Corvette Stingray, pushing it to 118 miles per hour, according to the speedometer that flashed across the screen in an upcoming episode of Jay Lenos Garage.

title: What You Can Learn From Your Fall Cleanup
description: Dont be in a hurry to get rid of all those dead leaves. Autumn is the best time to learn from your garden  if you slow down and pay attention.

title: How to Do a More Conscious Fall Cleanup
description: Plants are flopping, and leaves are dropping; the garden is letting go. But while we may have the urge to check garden cleanup off the to-do list with one heroic push, its not like mop kitchen floor.

title: Chasing Spirits: Mexico Citys House Museums
description: Within hours of arriving in Coyoacn  a leafy, tranquil, beautiful neighborhood in the southwest part of Mexico City  I was searching the internet for long-term rentals in the area. It was pure fantasy that my family could move there. It seemed as if my family and I had found the ideal base for exploring Mexico City, a place Id always loved. Its sidewalks lined with brightly colored houses and tenderly nurtured vegetation, Coyoacn is an oasis of tranquillity, almost like an island surrounded by the roiling 24/7 energy of the nations vibrant capital.

title: What You Get for $700,000
description: A Colonial Revival house in Columbus, Ohio; an 1870 Victorian in Buffalo; and a midcentury-modern home in Golden Valley, Minn.

title: $700,000 Homes in Ohio, New York and Minnesota
description: This house is just off Broad Street, a major thoroughfare that connects landmarks like the Ohio Statehouse, the Columbus Museum of Art, and Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens, an 88-acre complex with greenhouses and manicured gardens. Each of these sites is within a 10-minute drive of the house, as is Columbus State Community College. The main campus of Ohio State, ranked among the best public universities in the country and one of the citys largest employers, is about 15 minutes away.

title: Another Closely Watched Recession Alarm Is Ringing
description: A recession warning tracked by Wall Street is growing louder, as another measure of the widely watched yield curve signals that the United States is headed toward an economic slump.

title: In New Zealand, a 23-Million-Year-Old Fossil Is Carried Away by Parties Unknown
description: On the banks of Little Whanganui River, on New Zealands remote West Coast, the fossilized ribs and vertebrae of a whale have been embedded in a shelf of sandstone for about 23 million years.

title: The Trump Subpoena
description: A few days ago, when the House committee investigating Jan. 6 issued a subpoena to former President Donald J. Trump, it raised a legal question: Can Congress compel a former president to testify?

title: More Than 104,000 New York City Students Were Homeless Last Year
description: More than 104,000 public school students in New York City were homeless during the last school year, according to new data released Wednesday, a number that grew even as overall enrollment in the citys public schools declined.

title: A Social Media Status Update
description: For years, most of the conversation about social media companies was about how powerful and dominant they were.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond, Trying to Turn Things Around, Names New C.E.O.
description: Bed Bath & Beyond, the beleaguered retail chain that is in the midst of an attempted turnaround, said on Wednesday that Sue Gove would officially assume the title of chief executive after four months as an interim in the role.

title: How to Live With a Ghost
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Airlines Need New Planes, but the Supply Chain Has Other Ideas
description: Airlines are desperate to get more planes to meet insatiable and growing travel demand, but the two major plane manufacturers, Boeing and Airbus, are struggling to keep up.

title: Tech Stocks Tumble as Growth Falters
description: The recent rally in technology stocks could come to a screeching halt at the opening bell on Wednesday. Overnight, investors dumped portions of their tech portfolios after disappointing results from Alphabet, Microsoft and Texas Instruments, with the trio reporting that a slowing global economy continues to batter demand for digital advertising, cloud computing and chips.

title: Labour Party Comes Out Swinging at Britains New Prime Minister, Rishi Sunak
description: LONDON  A day after King Charles III welcomed him to the 1844 room in Buckingham Palace, laying out a table of treats for the festive holiday of Diwali, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak ventured into the less genteel confines of the House of Commons. His Labour Party opponents skipped the treats.

title: Californias New Top Doctor Takes On the States Health Challenges
description: California has a new top doctor.

title: Should a Park Include a Burial Ground? Residents of Newburgh, N.Y., Cant Agree.
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y.  All was calm on a recent morning in Downing Park, a pastoral landscape of rolling lawns, winding paths, majestic trees and a placid pond in which ducks were paddling. But tensions have been simmering in this city on the west bank of the Hudson River some 60 miles north of New York over plans for some new additions to the park.

title: Should I Tell a Young Relative That Her Grandmother Tried to Swindle Me?
description: Many years ago, my sister-in-law, who is now deceased, tried to steal our home. My husband and her husband were brothers and jointly owned a two-family house. My brother-in-law, also now deceased, promised to leave his half of the house to us in his will. But shortly after he underwent brain surgery, when he was confused, his wife had him sign a new will in her favor. Their children were complicit. My husband and I sued and won. My concern: My sister-in-law had a granddaughter who was very young at the time. Because of her grandmothers greed, the child lost all contact with our side of the family without any explanation. She is now 19. Should I contact her to explain what happened? It may help her with closure, though she may not remember us.

title: Shermans Showcase Is Back, Silly Smarts Intact
description: LOS ANGELES  He has kaleidoscope vision that impairs his precision.

title: The Latecomers Guide to TikTok
description: It has become impossible to ignore TikTok. Its been a hugely popular short-form video app for hyperkinetic bursts of self-expression for years, now with more than a billion active users worldwide (some even use it as a search engine).

title: How to Use TikToks Parental Controls
description: TikTok is massively influential, but there are ongoing concerns about the mental health risks the app may pose to young people. Here are some tips for parents.

title: Can Kanye West Find Refuge, or Money, in Music?
description: In early 2016, everything was lining up for Kanye West. Already a living legend in hip-hop, having delivered six straight paradigm-shifting albums, West, who is now known as Ye, was cashing in his cultural capital across multiple mediums.

title: Tech Stocks Sink as Investors Fret About Growth
description: Technology stocks slumped on Wednesday after a series of disappointing earnings reports from industry heavyweights rattled investors.

title: Rishi Sunak, New U.K. Leader, Delays Major Economic Plan
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has taken on the unenviable task of restoring Britains credibility in international markets, said on Wednesday that he would delay the announcement of a major economic plan by two and a half weeks as he seeks more time to make the right decisions.

title: George T. Stagg Bourbon Will Return in 2022
description: George T. Stagg, a sought-after Kentucky bourbon whose annual release is an event among aficionados, is returning for 2022, after a two-year absence.

title: Soon, Jaywalking Will No Longer Be a Crime in California
description: Jason Sarris was rebuilding his life. He was going to become sober, renew his drivers license and find stable housing after being homeless for 12 years. But there was one extra thing holding him back: Nearly $5,000 in fines for jaywalking and similar offenses.

title: How to Fall Back Without Missing a Beat
description: The transition to fall is scattered with seasonal markers: The occasional chill in the air; the wearing of the flannel shirt to the pumpkin patch; the urge to make soup.

title: The Texas Tribune Names a New C.E.O.
description: The Texas Tribune, one of the biggest nonprofit newsrooms in the country, announced on Wednesday that Sonal Shah will be its next chief executive.

title: Cozy Beef Udon Soup for Now
description: The Food section is as busy as a beehive this time of year. We are gearing up to support all your holiday feasts in the coming months, as well as getting ready for our own. People often ask me what I feed my family for dinner during these most hectic weeks  what is my quickest, easiest, most satisfying meal? My answer? Lemony red lentil soup, which I make all year to ward off hunger, illness and general ennui. It freezes perfectly, so I can keep it around for those nights when even chopping an onion and a carrot seems Sisyphean.

title: Evidence Invalidated in Explosive Report on Mexicos 43 Missing Students
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Newly Published, From Flamingo Feathers to North Korea
description: MAYBE YOU MIGHT, by Imogen Foxell. Illustrated by Anna Cunha. (Lantana, $17.99, ages 4 to 6.) This love poem to the planet in picture-book form tells the story of a young girl who plants a seed by a barren riverbed and watches as a lush ecosystem grows against all odds.

title: Tens of Thousands in Iran Mourn Mahsa Amini, Whose Death Set Off Protests
description: A day of mourning for Mahsa Amini, the young woman whose death sparked a protest movement in Iran, was marred by violence on Wednesday as security forces attacked and shot at demonstrators in parts of the country, according to media reports, rights groups and videos posted on social media.

title: Meadows Ordered to Testify in Georgia Election Investigation
description: PICKENS, S.C.  Mark Meadows, the former White House chief of staff who was deeply involved in efforts to keep former President Donald J. Trump in power after the 2020 election, was ordered by a South Carolina judge on Wednesday to travel to Atlanta to testify in a criminal investigation into election meddling.

title: Jury Convicts Men of Supporting Plot to Kidnap Michigan Governor
description: CHICAGO  Jurors in Michigan convicted three men on Wednesday of aiding a plot to kidnap the states Democratic governor in 2020, a case that grew out of a sprawling domestic terrorism investigation that revealed incendiary rhetoric and an openness to political violence on the far right.

title: N.H.L.s Phil Kessel Joins the Pantheon of Sports Durability
description: The N.H.L. has been disrupted several times since 2009, by labor disputes and a pandemic. But every time Phil Kessels team has taken the ice, he has laced up his skates.

title: TikToker Lands the Role of a Lifetime: Playing Dead on TV
description: The Otter Creek Outdoor Recreation Area, near Louisville, Ky., is Josh Nalleys favorite place to play dead.

title: The Young Woman Behind a Last Mystery of the Green River Killer
description: Cecile Gaspar wasnt home when the men first showed up. It was mid-October 2020, and she and her husband, Warren, were spending the day with a grandniece, their weekly babysitting engagement. But she caught a glimpse of the visitors through her doorbell camera and, noticing their tucked-in shirts, she shrugged them off as Mormon missionaries. They came by again while she was out.

title: New York, New York, a Film-Inspired Homage, Plans Broadway Bow
description: New York, New York, a new musical inspired by the 1977 Martin Scorsese film of the same name, will open on Broadway next spring.

title: Wisconsin Man Found Guilty of Killing 6 in Christmas Parade Attack
description: Darrell E. Brooks was found guilty on Wednesday of first-degree intentional homicide in the deaths of six people he struck with his car on a terrifying rampage through a Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wis., in 2021.

title: A Massive Fort in Northwest India, Rescued and Restored
description: This 21,465-square-foot historic fort in the Shekhawati region of Rajasthan, in northwest India, is for sale for $4.6 million.

title: Review: Carmen Returns to Its Comic Opera Roots
description: Do we truly know Bizets Carmen?

title: Creamy Paneer, Tangy Tomatoes and a Gorgeously Easy Dinner
description: If youre going to eat dairy, you should go all in, said Anita Jaisinghani, the chef and owner of Pondicheri in Houston.

title: Most Parents Dont Favor Abstinence-Only Sex Ed. Why Is the Government Still Funding It?
description: Pew Research Center published a report today titled Parents Differ Sharply by Party Over What Their K-12 Children Should Learn in School. Some of the questions and answers were predictable, particularly since theyve become political wedge issues in recent years: For example, 70 percent of Democrats or those who lean Democratic think schoolchildren should learn that the legacy of slavery still affects the position of Black people in American society, while 24 percent of Republicans or those who lean Republican agree. A 37 percent plurality of parents think children shouldnt be learning about gender identity in school.

title: An Influx of Migrants Into New York
description: To the Editor:

title: More Than 100 N.Y.C. Middle Schools Will Drop Selective Screens
description: Nearly 90 percent of New York City public middle schools will continue to use a lottery system to admit students, school officials announced Wednesday, a sea change that could add more diversity to schools in a system marked by racial segregation.

title: Texas Goes Permitless on Guns, and Police Face an Armed Public
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: When Soup and Mashed Potatoes Are Thrown, Can the Earth Win?
description: First it was cake smeared on the Mona Lisa in Paris, then tomato soup splattered across a van Gogh in London, and then, on Sunday, liquefied mashed potatoes hurled at a Monet in a museum in Potsdam.

title: CNN Signals Layoffs and Budget Cuts Before End of Year
description: Chris Licht, the chairman of CNN, told employees in a memo on Wednesday afternoon that executives would take a hard look at spending across the business, signaling budget cuts and layoffs before the end of the year.

title: With The Good Nurse, a Director Takes on a Serial Killer and a System
description: The true-crime thriller The Good Nurse is ultimately an indictment of American systems: the hospitals that turned a blind eye to the atrocities of Charles Cullen, a nurse who admitted to killing 29 patients and may have killed dozens more as he quietly moved from job to job; and the interlocking demands of employment and health care benefits that held back Amy Loughren, a fellow nurse who eventually helped bring Cullen to justice.

title: How Is Your Company Responding to Labor Organizing? We Want to Hear.
description: There has been a surge in labor organizing among baristas at Starbucks, warehouse workers at Amazon and retail workers at Apple and Trader Joes. They have made their voices heard, though only a fraction of each group has joined a union, and some have rejected unionization.

title: Why a Democrat Is Diverging From Party Orthodoxy in New York City
description: As a Democrat running for Congress in New York City, former Representative Max Rose would seem to have a straightforward playbook to follow: tie his Republican opponent to former President Donald J. Trump, pledge his commitment to the Democratic agenda and highlight his left-leaning stances on social issues that draw voters to polls.

title: Review: What Happens in the Theater Before and After the Dance?
description: The scaffolding has been rolled in. Stage lights are scattered around the floor. It looks like the show is over, or hasnt happened yet.

title: Russia Intensifies Its Propaganda Campaign Against Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  Since before the war, Russia has spread disinformation about its need to stamp out Nazism in Ukraine. But in recent days, Moscows propaganda has shifted, arguing that it is battling terrorism and falsely accusing Ukraine of planning a dirty bomb attack as part of that narrative.

title: Fetterman Was an Uneven Debater Before His Stroke in May
description: Before Tuesdays Senate debate in Pennsylvania, and before his stroke in May, Lt. Gov. John Fetterman was an uneven debater, given to hesitations, a slightly sing-songy voice and a dismissive attitude when challenged. Mr. Fetterman, the Democratic nominee, favored broad pronouncements over policy details.

title: Youre Suffocating Us: Israeli Blockade in West Bank Angers Palestinians
description: HUWARA, West Bank  As an Israeli Army front-end loader approached, the Palestinian mayor tried one last time to stop the soldiers from blocking an intersection in Huwara, his town in the northern West Bank.

title: Augusta National and U.S.G.A. Drawn Into Justice Department Antitrust Inquiry
description: DORAL, Fla.  The Justice Departments antitrust inquiry into mens professional golf  a sport splintered this year by the emergence of a lucrative circuit financed by Saudi Arabias sovereign wealth fund  has in recent months come to include the organizers of some of the most hallowed and influential tournaments in the world, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Fred Again.. Turns Digital Bricolage Into Dance-Floor Weepers
description: On a recent Friday night in Manhattan, pandemonium surrounded a waffle truck parked on the corner of 56th Street and 11th Avenue, as thumping beats and the aroma of fresh batter poured from within. An enthusiastic young woman thrust an inflatable giraffe head festooned with a red glow stick through one of the trucks windows, bopping it to the music. A security guard ripped it away.

title: An Abandoned Fort Gets New Life in Rajasthan: House Hunting in India
description: This 21,465-square-foot historic fort is in the Shekhawati region of Rajasthan, in northwest India. The birthplace of the last ruler of Sikar, Maharajah Rao Raja Kalyan Singh Bahadur (1886-1967), the property was long abandoned before an Italian jewelry designer gave it a faithful restoration, transforming it into a boutique hotel of 13 bedrooms.

title: Ahmed Alshaiba, Yemeni Music Master, Is Dead at 32
description: Ahmed Alshaiba, who as a teenager in Yemen taught himself the oud, a fretless lutelike Arabic instrument, and who after immigrating to the United States built an online following with his cover versions of pop songs that deftly blended Western and Middle Eastern influences, died on Sept. 28 in a car accident. He was 32.

title: Gene Treatment for Rare Epilepsy Causes Brain Side Effect in 2 Children
description: Weeks after Valeria Schenkel took an experimental drug named after her, the daily seizures that had afflicted her from birth became less frequent. But the drug caused fluid to build up in her brain, and a year later, she died at age 3.

title: Does the Constitution Guarantee a Right to Vote? The Answer May Surprise You.
description: The Constitution makes reference to voting 15 times in the original document and another 22 in the amendments. But somewhat surprisingly, none of those mentions makes an explicit declaration that Americans have a right to vote  something many politicians and their supporters consider fundamental to democracy. Heres a look at why that is, and what rights voters actually have.

title: Maaf Is the Versatile, Warming Stew You Should Be Making This Fall
description: For me, fall feels incomplete without a day at Oko Farms, my dear friend Ym Amus sustainable aquaponic farm on the Williamsburg, Brooklyn, waterfront, and the chance to get creative with whatever I bring home.

title: Theres Lightning Brewing in Every Swarm of Insects
description: Electrical charges are everywhere, both positive and negative ones. As opposite charges pull on each other, like charges push each other away. While these forces often go unnoticed on a human scale, they can have an outsize effect on small animals and plants.

title: What to Know About the Pine-Sol Recall
description: Clorox is voluntarily recalling about 37 million bottles of scented Pine-Sol because the cleaning products may contain bacteria that can cause serious infections in people with weakened immune systems, the Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

title: Hound Dog Review: A Soul-Searching Journey Strays Off Course
description: The young woman nicknamed Hound Dog might have studied musicology at Harvard, but all the panel members at her Royal Academy of Music audition seem to care about is that shes from Turkey.

title: Mike Davis, Who Wrote of Los Angeles and Catastrophe, Dies at 76
description: Mike Davis, an urban theorist and historian who in stark, sometimes prescient books wrote of catastrophes faced by and awaiting humankind, and especially Los Angeles, died on Tuesday at his home in San Diego. He was 76.

title: The Pandemic Led to More Babies Last Year, Not Fewer
description: When the Covid pandemic hit and the economy sank early in 2020, there were widespread predictions (including by me) of a sharp decline in births in the United States. The predictions, based in part on the experience in previous economic downturns, seemed to be borne out by data for 2020, the first and roughest year of the pandemic, when the U.S. birthrate dropped.

title: The Curious Case of the Alexander McQueen Graffiti Skirt
description: In September, just as New York Fashion Week began and the day after Queen Elizabeth II died, the artist Adam Pendleton got a text from a friend. It contained a picture of Anna Wintour, the Vogue editor, at a cocktail party hosted by Mayor Eric Adams to celebrate the start of the collections. In the picture, Ms. Wintour was standing next to Mayor Adams wearing a black T-shirt and black sunglasses, with a full skirt that featured overlapping black and white graffiti.

title: Republicans Target a Top House Democrat as Winds Shift to the Right
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y.  Representative Sean Patrick Maloney of New York was campaigning at a senior center recently, trying to give a largely Democratic audience reason for hope. But Pat Campbell, 84, had little patience for optimism.

title: Fettermans Debate Showing Raises Democratic Anxieties in Senate Battle
description: The debate performance on Tuesday night by Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, the Democratic nominee for Senate in Pennsylvania, left party officials newly anxious, injecting a fresh dose of unpredictability into one of the countrys most important contests less than two weeks before Election Day.

title: Dutch Are Investigating Reported Illegal Chinese Police Stations
description: The Dutch government said on Wednesday that it was investigating reports that Chinese law enforcement agencies illegally operate offices in the Netherlands  without Dutch knowledge or approval  to police Chinese citizens overseas.

title: Elon Musk Visits Twitter as $44 Billion Deal Nears Completion
description: Elon Musk appears to be on track to close his blockbuster $44 billion deal for Twitter.

title: Nurse Charged With Murder of Two Patients by Lethal Insulin Doses
description: A nurse in North Carolina has been charged with murder over what a prosecutor said were lethal doses of insulin given to two patients in January.

title: New U.S. sanctions target Russian efforts to manipulate the politics in Moldova, a neighbor of Ukraine.
description: The Biden administration on Wednesday imposed sanctions on more than 20 Moldovan and Russian individuals and entities for assisting Russian efforts to manipulate Moldovas political system.

title: Prince Harrys Memoir Is Due in January. How Explosive Will It Be?
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: 20 Democratic Senators Ask Supreme Court to Reject Once-Fringe Theory in Elections Case
description: A group of 20 Democratic senators filed a brief on Wednesday urging the Supreme Court to reject a legal argument that would give state legislatures extraordinary power over federal elections.

title: The Runner Is a Gem of the Iranian New Wave
description: The Runner, Amir Naderis stylized memoir of his boyhood in Iran, is a notable feat  a movie at once objective and subjective and single-minded throughout. Shooting from the viewpoint of an illiterate street kid, Naderi employs a mature artists disciplined technique to celebrate a childs new-minted vision of his hardscrabble world.

title: Not the Daughter She Wanted
description: Her whole life, Putsata Reang (Put, for short) was accustomed to exceeding her parents expectations. She excelled in her career, paid for her parents to go on trips together and maintained a tight connection to her siblings and community.

title: Signs of a Tripledemic
description: This winter, the U.S. could be in for a tripledemic, a nasty collision of three viruses  the flu, the coronavirus and respiratory syncytial virus (R.S.V.)  which could cause a surge of patients seeking treatment at hospitals that are already stretched thin.

title: What the Pennsylvania Media Is Saying About the Senate Debate
description: Pennsylvania voters are navigating through a vortex of headlines, commentary and opinion page takeaways about Tuesday nights Senate debate between the celebrity physician Dr. Mehmet Oz, a Republican, and Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, a Democrat who is recovering from a stroke that he had in May.

title: Most Hospitalized Monkeypox Patients in the U.S. Were H.I.V.-Positive
description: Nearly all Americans hospitalized for monkeypox infection had weakened immune systems, most often because of H.I.V. infection, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported on Wednesday.

title: Pierre Soulages, Leading French Abstract Painter, Dies at 102
description: Pierre Soulages, whose searching explorations of the color black established him as Frances pre-eminent postwar abstract painter, died on Wednesday in Ste, a port city in southern France. He was 102.

title: Ford Lost Money in the Third Quarter as Costs Surged
description: Ford Motor on Wednesday said it lost money in the third quarter as rising costs took a toll on the company and it wrote down the value of an investment in a self-driving technology business.

title: The Information War Heats Up
description: Welcome to the Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, your guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Metas Profit Slides by More Than 50 Percent as Challenges Mount
description: A year ago, Mark Zuckerberg changed Facebooks name to Meta and said he was going all in on the immersive digital world of the so-called metaverse.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Khruangbin and More
description: I am the editor of Arts & Leisure. Here are five things I've been enjoying lately.

title: New York Road Runners Chose Her as Its Next Chairman. In 1996, She Failed a Doping Test.
description: By nearly every measuring stick, Nnenna Lynch has had a standout career, in athletics and in her professional life.

title: Unnamed Woman Says Walker Pressured and Paid for Her to Have Abortion in 93
description: A woman who did not identify herself said on Wednesday that Herschel Walker pressured her to have an abortion and paid for the procedure nearly three decades ago after a yearslong extramarital relationship. A former football star, Mr. Walker is running for the Senate in Georgia as an abortion opponent.

title: The New World: Envisioning Life After Climate Change
description: Scientists increasingly agree on how much warming the planet will experience. This is what it might look like.

title: W.H.O. Lists Top Fungal Health Threats
description: The World Health Organization has released a ranking of fungi that threaten human health in its most ambitious effort to draw attention to a constellation of pathogens that are largely overlooked, even as they have become increasingly widespread, resistant to treatment and deadly.

title: The U.S. re-evaluates ties with Saudi Arabia over an oil-production cut that could benefit Russia.
description: WASHINGTON  The American secretary of state said on Wednesday that the United States would re-evaluate its relationship with Saudi Arabia over the kingdoms decision to support Russia by agreeing to cut oil production next month, a move that the White House has asserted helps Moscows war effort against Ukraine.

title: Senator Robert Menendez Faces a New Federal Investigation
description: Five years after standing trial on corruption charges, Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey is again being scrutinized by federal authorities, an adviser said Wednesday.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Irans Protests Intensify
description: Tens of thousands of demonstrators in Iran gathered yesterday to mark the 40th day of the traditional Islamic mourning period for Mahsa Amini, whose death in police custody set off protests across the country.

title: Jody Miller, Singer of Queen of the House and More, Dies at 80
description: Jody Miller, a versatile singer with a rich, resonant voice who won a Grammy Award for Queen of the House, a homemakers reply to a hobos refrain, and had her biggest hit with a teenage anthem, Home of the Brave, died on Oct. 6 at her home in Blanchard, Okla. She was 80.

title: You Be the Ump
description: This could be one of the last World Series with umpires calling balls and strikes. Now its your turn behind the plate: Are you more accurate than a major league umpire?

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pennsylvania House Moves to Impeach Philadelphias Progressive D.A.
description: Republicans in the Pennsylvania House of Representatives filed articles of impeachment on Wednesday against Larry Krasner, the unabashedly progressive district attorney of Philadelphia, charging that he had been derelict in his obligations to prosecute crimes in a city struggling with a spike in gun violence.

title: How People With Disabilities Saw Fettermans Debate Performance
description: For many Americans with disabilities who watched the Senate debate in Pennsylvania on Tuesday, Lt. Gov. John Fettermans performance against Dr. Mehmet Oz was both a sign of how far they had come in political representation and a painful reminder of how far they have left to go.

title: Connections Abound, but Philadelphia Has an Edge on Houston
description: HOUSTON  The 118th World Series, which starts in Houston on Friday with the Astros hosting the Philadelphia Phillies, will be the ultimate test for an esoteric but fascinating theory: When it comes to professional sports, Philadelphia owns Houston.

title: Yes, Americans Are Really Down on the Economy. But Why?
description: This article is part of the Debatable newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it on Wednesdays.

title: Meet Me Downtown
description: We visited 10 cities across the country to see how the pandemic and its aftershocks have reshaped the American downtown.

title: Fetterman vs. Oz Is Not Really Fetterman vs. Oz
description: So, how many of you watched the Pennsylvania Senate debate because you want to back the most articulate candidate?

title: For Sale: Yeezys, Never Worn
description: Brea Cowans is selling her Yeezys for just $75. She started out with 15 pairs and is down to her final two. For Ms. Cowans, 28, Kanye Wests recent antisemitic statements were the last straw, enough for her to disavow Mr. West, an artist whose music and fashion designs she has been a fan of for years.

title: Techs Biggest Companies Are Sending Worrying Signals About the Economy
description: Google this week reported a steep decline in profits. Social media companies such as Meta said that advertising sales  the heart of their businesses  have rapidly cooled off. And Microsoft, perhaps the tech industrys most reliable performer, predicted a slowdown through at least the end of the year.

title: Beyond Catastrophe: A New Climate Reality Is Coming Into View
description: There's plenty of bad news. But thanks to real progress, we're headed toward a less apocalyptic future.

title: An Alternate History of the 2022 Midterms
description: In Blame It on Cain, his biblically infused 1978 song lamenting the fickleness of fate, Elvis Costello croons, Its nobodys fault, but we need somebody to burn.

title: Pennsylvania Voters Absorb an Unusual Debate: I Felt Sorry for Fetterman
description: LEMOYNE, Pa.  Two professors walked separately out of a grocery store just outside Pennsylvanias capital city on Wednesday. Each had different political leanings and different preferences in the states Senate race.

title: Reports of Looting in Kherson as Ukrainians Battle to Retake the City
description: KYIV, Ukraine  With the city of Kherson shaping up to be the site of the next major battle in Ukraine, occupying forces there raised the pressure on residents Wednesday to abandon their homes and leave for Russia, warning that if they stayed they would be considered hostile and treated accordingly.

title: Prosecutors Seek Testimony on Trumps Claims to Have Declassified Documents
description: Federal prosecutors investigating former President Donald J. Trumps handling of national security documents want to question one of his confidants about a claim that Mr. Trump had declassified national security documents he took when he left the White House.

title: Garland Formally Bars Justice Dept. From Seizing Reporters Records
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department on Wednesday formally banned the use of subpoenas, warrants or court orders to seize reporters communications records or demand their notes or testimony in an effort to uncover confidential sources in leak investigations, in what amounts to a major policy shift.

title: Thank Ye Very Much
description: Dear Kanye West, or Ye:

title: Biden Faces New Challenges Holding Together a Coalition to Support Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  The White House said on Wednesday that it sees no current prospects for negotiations to end the war in Ukraine, even as President Biden faces new challenges keeping together the bipartisan, multinational coalition supporting the effort to drive out Russian invaders.

title: Justice Kagan Temporarily Blocks a Jan. 6 Committee Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Elena Kagan on Wednesday temporarily blocked a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol for phone records of Kelli Ward, the chairwoman of the Arizona Republican Party.

title: It Takes a Lot of Elephant Brains to Solve This Mystery
description: An elephants trunk has 40,000 muscles and weighs more than a Burmese python. The appendage is strong enough to uproot a tree, yet sensitive enough to suction up fragile tortilla chips.

title: New York Fire Department to Be Led by Woman for First Time
description: Mayor Eric Adams on Thursday named a woman to lead the New York City Fire Department for the first time in the agencys 157-year history.

title: Straight Line Crazy Review: The Road Rage of Robert Moses
description: I doubt Id have enjoyed meeting the real Robert Moses, New Yorks paver of highways, evictor of minorities, eminent domain eminence and all-purpose boogeyman. But its a huge pleasure to meet him, in the form of Ralph Fiennes, in David Hares Straight Line Crazy, which opened on Wednesday at the Shed.

title: Kanye West Fallout Imperils Season for Donda Academy Basketball
description: The fallout from Kanye Wests embrace of white supremacist tropes and antisemitic statements continued Thursday as one of his vanity projects, a star-studded high school basketball team, Donda Academy, teetered on the brink of collapse after organizers of two prominent high school boys basketball tournaments revoked invitations to play in national showcases and at least one player left the school.

title: Jan. 6 Rioter Gets 5 Years Probation as Judge Cites Autism Diagnosis
description: A 29-year-old Maryland man who federal prosecutors said was one of the first rioters to enter the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, was sentenced Wednesday to five years of probation by a federal judge who cited the mans autism as an extenuating circumstance.

title: The Study of Bubbles
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  This one by Barb Lin may be tough going for those who are just beginning to solve Thursday puzzles.

title: Australian Judge Orders New Trial in Rape Case That Shook Capital
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The high-profile trial of a former parliamentary staffer accused of raping a colleague in Australias Parliament House was halted on Thursday after the court discovered that a juror had brought a research article on sexual assault cases into the jury room.

title: Sheriff Found Guilty of Violating Detainees Rights With Restraint Chairs
description: A Georgia sheriff who had ordered several detainees to be strapped to restraint chairs for hours at a time was found guilty on Wednesday of violating their civil rights, according to the U.S. Attorneys Office for the Northern District of Georgia.

title: Man Arrested in Burglary of Campaign Office of Candidate for Arizona Governor
description: A man has been charged in the Monday night burglary of the campaign headquarters for the Democratic candidate for Arizona, and the police didnt have to go far to find him.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Mood of America Goes Up and Down With the Price of Gas
description: There is no other consumer good or service with price tags that are visible from the street, all the time.

title: Corrections: Oct. 27, 2022
description: An article on Wednesday about Dr. Christopher Nowinski, a former wrestler who is working to push sports leagues to acknowledge the link between concussions and chronic traumatic encephalopathy referred incorrectly to the earlier research of the doctors Nowinski sought out at Boston University. They were studying Alzheimers disease, not C.T.E. It also misstated the past position of the consensus statements on C.T.E. They did not previously acknowledge the uniqueness of C.T.E., but did accept its existence.

title: N.F.L. Week 8 Predictions: Our Picks for Each Game
description: Bookmakers power ratings differ quite a bit from the usual rankings pundits put together. Their ratings  a number of points a team should win by against the average team on a neutral field  take into account all available data, and are combined to come up with an opening point spread. But, remarkably, bookmakers power ratings, and thus, spreads, dont factor in win-loss records.

title: War in Ukraine Likely to Speed, Not Slow, Shift to Clean Energy, I.E.A. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The energy crisis sparked by Russias invasion of Ukraine is likely to speed up rather than slow down the global transition away from fossil fuels and toward cleaner technologies like wind, solar and electric vehicles, the worlds leading energy agency said Thursday.

title: Putin Wants to Divide Ukrainians. Mykolaiv Is a Test Case.
description: MYKOLAIV, Ukraine  As Elizaveta Kachuk waited in line for drinking water, a daily ritual that is not always successful, she cursed the Russians who bombed her city. But she also voiced discontent with her fellow Ukrainians still running it.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The White House said yesterday that it saw no current prospects for negotiations to end the war in Ukraine, even as President Biden faces new obstacles to keeping together the bipartisan, multinational coalition supporting the effort to drive out Russian invaders, as American midterm elections and a cold European winter loom.

title: How Does Britains Conservative Government End? Maybe With a Labour Rout.
description: On Tuesday Rishi Sunak became the third Conservative prime minister of Britain this year, elevated to the nations highest political office with the endorsement of fewer than 200 lawmakers   an easy hurdle if one compares it to the tens of millions of voters who would need convincing in a general election.

title: Russians Know the Reality of War, and Many of Them Still Support Putin
description: Dont count your chickens before they hatch, an old English proverb says. Its Russian counterpart advises you to count your chickens in the fall.

title: Putin begins a high-profile address amid fears that he is escalating the war.
description: President Vladimir V. Putin began to deliver a wide-ranging speech on Thursday that was expected to offer an opportunity to gauge the Russians leaders appetite for escalating the war in Ukraine to avoid defeat.

title: Samsung Heir Elevated to Chairman After Jail Stint
description: SEOUL  Samsung Electronics announced Thursday that it had named Lee Jae-yong as executive chairman, officially elevating the heir and longtime de facto leader of the South Korean tech and industrial giant, less than 15 months after he was released from prison for bribery.

title: Word of the Day: deprecate
description: The word deprecate has appeared in 130 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Dec. 2 in He Says Hes No Murderer. Thats Why Hes Still in Prison by Tom Robbins:

title: The Challenge of Educating New Yorks 104,000 Homeless Children
description: Good morning. Its Thursday. Well look at students in city schools who are homeless and the challenges that teachers and administrators face. Well also look at a new investigation of Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey.

title: Skechers Says It Escorted Kanye West From Its Offices After Unannounced Visit
description: The footwear company Skechers said late Wednesday that Kanye West had come to its corporate offices in Los Angeles unannounced and uninvited and was subsequently escorted from the building, where he had been trying to film.

title: Stephen Colbert Ponders Dr. Ozs Views on Abortion
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: THURSDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Haunted Houses
description: Do you believe in ghosts? Have you ever been in a haunted house? Have strange or eerie things you couldnt explain ever happened in your own home?

title: Can Hypebeast Magic Revive J. Crew?
description: How does a design success come to feel like a flub? Is it when a clear vision doesnt find the right platform? Is it when a ballyhooed debut limps onto the sales floor? Or is it just a matter of a trial balloon looking like its leaking air?

title: Is She the New Queen of Los Angeles?
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Earlier this year, Sarah Staudinger began taking a Polaroid of nearly every person to visit her freshly renovated home.

title: How a Black-Owned Condom Brand Pitches Itself as the Right Fit
description: Jason Panda cares deeply about branding. During a recent video interview, the logo for his company, B Condoms, was visible in no fewer than four places: on a blue wall behind him in an Atlanta warehouse, on his white T-shirt, on a condom package that just so happened to be within arms reach and on a cornhole board in a nearby storage room.

title: A Rising Dollar Is Hurting Other Currencies. Central Banks Are Stepping In.
description: Governments around the world have sought to stabilize their currencies and defend their economies against the Federal Reserves rapid interest rate increases, which have tilted the field in favor of the dollar. Their efforts highlight both the interconnected nature of the global financial system and its vulnerabilities.

title: How Mike Lindells Pillow Business Propels the Election Denial Movement
description: Three days after federal agents seized his cellphone as part of an investigation into voting machine tampering, Mike Lindell seemed energized and ready to sell pillows.

title: Credit Suisse Unveils Sweeping Revamp to Revive Its Fortunes
description: After decades of chasing the prestige and profits of its rivals on Wall Street, Credit Suisse is pulling back to save itself.

title: Lesson Plan: Explore How the Election Denial Movement Threatens Democracy
description: Featured Article: Over 370 Republican Candidates Have Cast Doubt on the 2020 Election

title: Mexicos Senate Votes to Eliminate Daylight Saving Time
description: Mexicos Senate voted on Wednesday to end daylight saving time for most of the country, signaling a preference for more daylight in the mornings and potentially ending a biannual turning of the clocks.

title: The European Central Bank Raises Rates Again in the Fight Against Inflation
description: As clouds continue to gather over Europes economy, the European Central Bank imposed another large interest-rate increase on Thursday, as policymakers tried to quickly quell the regions record-high inflation.

title: Brazils Presidential Election Will Determine the Planets Future
description: And your chances of surviving on it, too.

title: 50 Years Ago, Stevie Wonder Heard the Future
description: On the anniversary of the landmark 1972 album Talking Book, musicians who made it and artists who cherish it share their stories.

title: 36 Hours in Sydney
description: Swim in a magnificent ocean pool, slurp a curry laksa and meet new friends in a teeny mezcal bar: Sydney is back.

title: Its Still the Roberts Court. And Thats a Good Thing.
description: This past summer seemed to mark not just the end of Roe v. Wade but also the end of the Roberts court. In Dobbs v. Jackson Womens Health Organization, Chief Justice John Roberts urged his colleagues to neither overturn nor affirm Roe and to instead decide the case on narrower, fact-specific grounds  not to decide more than is necessary.

title: Considering the Post-Trump Era in a Tucson Sports Bar
description: TUCSON, Ariz.  It can be hard to make sense of endings and beginnings in politics and history, but what if weve already reached the post-Trump era?

title: Seeking a Manhattan Studio With Design Potential for $600,000. Which Option Did He Choose?
description: After redecorating his Harlem apartment several times, a New York native decided to upgrade more than just his furniture with a new West Side place he could make his own. Here's what he found.

title: What Are Your Memories of Halloween?
description: Are you someone who loves Halloween? Do you look forward to it every fall? Or would you rather skip the holiday?

title: Teachers Are Arming Themselves. This Sheriff Wants Them to Get Trained.
description: At least 29 states have laws that make it possible for people like teachers to carry guns in schools. In Utah, teachers only need a concealed carry permit  no additional training required. As the Utah County sheriff, Mike Smith wants educators to understand what it means to arm themselves. So he created the Teachers Academy, a six-week course to prepare  as much as one can  for a school shooting.

title: Brazils Presidential Election Will Determine the Planets Future
description: On Oct. 30, Brazilians go to the polls to elect their next president. But at stake is something far more important than just the leadership of one of the worlds largest economies.

title: How to Help a Partner Living With Depression
description: Jeff Zuckerman and his wife had been married for 30 years when she started battling bipolar disorder and depression. She had her first monthslong manic episode in the spring of 2015. Immediately after, she was thrust into a severe depression. The health crises rocked the couples marriage.

title: Kevin Wilson Likes Books That Mix Tenderness With Weirdness
description: So many. My wife and I take turns reading each night to our boys, who are 14 and 10. Ill read to Griff on one night, while she reads to Patch, and then we switch the next night, so there are always multiple books in play. Griff and I are reading The Big Sleep, by Raymond Chandler, and Patch and I are reading The Legend of Molly Bolin, about the first woman to sign a contract in the Womens Professional Basketball League. We both have a huge crush on Molly Bolin. I am rereading Elizabeth Tans wildly original Rubik for a class that Im teaching, and then Im also reading Courtney Summerss new novel, Im the Girl, and Margaret Wilkerson Sextons On the Rooftop. And then I keep little chapbooks like Meghan Phillipss Abstinence Only or zines by Luke Geddes on my night stand because I just like having them always close.

title: Protesters So Ill, They Couldnt Get Arrested
description: Gabriel San Emeterio, one of 50 or so protesters at the White House demanding more funding for treatment of and research into their condition, M.E./C.F.S., is H.I.V. positive, and San Emeterio told me that H.I.V. has been less onerous than this more obscure affliction.

title: The Grass Roots, Part 1
description: On todays episode: Why this moment in politics will be defined by shifts at the grass-roots level. We talk to conservative voters about the forces animating the midterm elections for them  and what Washington can learn from the people.

title: Where Are New York City Home Prices Changing the Most?
description: The pandemic boosted home prices to record highs in 2021, and for the most part theyve remained there, with rising interest rates putting home purchases even further out of reach for many buyers.

title: If Not the Parkland Shooter, Who Is the Death Penalty For?
description: A Florida jurys recommendation this month that Nikolas Cruz, who murdered 17 students and teachers in Parkland in 2018, be spared execution produced great anguish and anger in many of the victims families. Justice was not served today, said the father of Scott Beigel, a teacher who sheltered students until he was fatally shot. What do we have the death penalty for? demanded the father of a 14-year-old victim, Alyssa Alhadeff.

title: The $4,990 Ice Bath
description: In the early days of the pandemic, the celebrity trainer and nutritionist Harley Pasternak bought a chest freezer for his backyard. At the time, Mr. Pasternak, 48, who works with Ariana Grande, Maude Apatow and H.E.R., thought he might need it to store extra food. But when the grocery stores in West Hollywood stayed open, he converted the freezer into a makeshift cold plunge: a tank of icy cold water that he could dip into for a few minutes a day to ease his back pain and anxiety.

title: Biden Stresses Economic Optimism, Seeking Contrast With Republicans
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y.  President Biden hailed a major chip manufacturers pledge to invest $100 billion in new manufacturing facilities in upstate New York on Thursday, his latest attempt to try to convince voters ahead of the midterm elections that his administration has strengthened the American economy.

title: Parenting Alone, and Bearing the Weight of Everything
description: This article is part of a series recounting the stories of people who received help from nonprofit organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Are Wedding Sweepstakes Worth It?
description: By her count, Kelley Arslanian enters some 20 online sweepstakes a day.

title: Tangling With the Ghost of a Vengeful Mother-in-Law
description: BookTok rants, enraged Goodreads reviews, sociopathic stalking on Twitter  is there no limit to what an author must endure in 2022? According to Meg Elisons riveting new novel, NUMBER ONE FAN (Mira, 345 pp., paperback, $16.99), the answer is: no. Whatever horrors you might imagine, the literary life can get a lot worse.

title: Covid, Flu, RSV: Hospitalizations Rise as Wave of Viruses Hits New York
description: Just in time for colder weather and with other respiratory viruses on the rise, the mix of Covid-19 variants is shifting again in New York City in potentially worrying ways.

title: Living In ... South Harlem, Manhattan
description: Although some resent efforts to brand the area as a separate space within Harlem, its clearly a neighborhood in transition.

title: A Godfather of Chinese Nationalism Has Second Thoughts
description: Wang Xiaodong once gave a speech declaring that Chinas forward march is unstoppable. He published essays calling on China to build up its military. He co-wrote a book, bluntly titled China Is Unhappy, in which he said the country should aim to control more land and shape global politics. We should lead this world, he said.

title: A Power Balance Shifts as Europe, Facing a Gas Crisis, Turns to Africa for Help
description: European leaders have been converging on Africas capital cities, eager to find alternatives to Russian natural gas  sparking hope among their counterparts in Africa that the invasion of Ukraine may tilt the scales in the continents unequal relationship with Europe, attracting a new wave of gas investments despite pressure to pivot to renewables.

title: South Harlem: A Busy, Interesting Place to Live
description: From her South Harlem condo, Michelle Thompson has an easy walk to her favorite waterfall in Central Park  easy enough that she can visit several times a week.

title: J.D. Vances Ambition Comes at a Price in Hillbilly Terms
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio  Blue jeans evoked his hardscrabble upbringing, and a crisp dress shirt conveyed his success as a Yale Law School graduate, venture capitalist and best-selling memoirist  with the open collar signaling that he was still just J.D., who happens to be the Ohio Republican candidate for the Senate.
